intro: Viola calcarata var. halleri, commonly known as the Haller's violet, is a species of flowering plant in the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive violet-blue flowers with yellow markings and heart-shaped leaves. Native to the Alps and other mountainous regions of Europe, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in rocky or alpine meadows, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
